document_data.caption: A map showing the Ashenwood in central Rashemen.
document_data.name: Ashenwood
document_data.mainbody: The '''Ashenwood''' was a wild evergreen forest in [[Rashemen]] known for its large number of [[fey]] inhabitants. The [[Rashemaar]] people considered the Ashenwood a sacred site that filled with ancient [[magic]], and refused to settle within its borders.

Geography.Flora & Fauna:
[[File:Ashenwood.png|thumb|''Ashenwood's flora and fauna.''|520x520px]]
The forest comprised a number of different varieties of trees, including [[pine]]s and [[fir]]s, along with [[ash]] and [[aspen trees]].

It was alive with all manner of forest critters, such as [[badger]]s, [[porcupine]]s, [[skunk]]s, [[deer]], [[squirrel]]s, [[raccoon]]s, and [[fox]]es.

document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1368}}, agents of [[Thay]] set fire to a large swathe of the Ashenwood, driving out the forest's bestial creatures towards the villages and towns found east of the trees.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: Mothers in Rashemaar families told their children of the "[[Wood Man]]" a terrifying specter that haunted the Ashenwood forest. The being was in fact quite real and no mere legend at all.
document_data.Notable Locations: The [[River Rasha]] and [[River Ashan]] both originated as underground waterways deep beneath the Ashenwood forest.

Inhabitants.Notable Inhabitants:
*[[Bristlebeard]], an ''[[awaken]]ed'' [[dire boar]] with a benevolent streak.
*[[Dar-Guran]], the vicious [[dire troll]] that was over a century old.
*[[Gnarlthorn]], a [[treant]] that sought to combat a blight in the forest.
*[[Hornclaw|Hornclaw the Gray]], a particularly massive owlbear.
*[[Stormwind]], a wise treant that allied itself with the local [[Wychlaran]].
